json.text: Rising from the Andaman Sea in emerald perfection is Langkawi,
an archipelago of 99 island jewels,
just 30 kilometers off the northwestern coast of Peninsular Malaysia.
The Langkawi Archipelago is also a UNESCO-listed geopark.
The centerpiece of this treasure is Pulau Langkawi,
one of the most popular holiday destinations in Asia.
Blessed with stunning beaches, jungle-clad mountains, sensational food,
vibrant nightlife, and duty-free shopping, Pulau Langkawi has something for everyone.
There are beaches to suit every taste, and accommodations for all,
from budget-minded travelers and families to those seeking the finest in resort opulence.
Visitors can simply while away the perfect days in a hammock,
or throw themselves into the many activities and sights that Langkawi has to offer.
Take the cable car to the astonishing sky bridge,
or dive into the under-sea wonderland of the Pulau Payar Marine Park.
Tee off on a world-class golf course,
or trek through unspoilt forests and conservation areas with expert ecoguides.
Explore uninhabited islands and secluded bays,
or strut your stuff on the dancefloor with partygoers from all over the world.
Endowed with the finest natural and cultural heritage,
and generous to all who visit,
it's not hard to see why Langkawi is known as the Jewel of Kedah.
